title: How do phones with multiple cameras work? - Quora

response.answer_text: they have a main camera. And different cameras that activate by the user’s will. And some cameras are just supportive modules Let’s say we’re using the note 10+ of Samsung. It has 4 cameras. 3 functional (Wide, Ultra wide, Telephoto) and 1 Supportive ToF (Time of Flight) camera that measures distances and adds with Blur and bokeh. When first launched. 2 cameras are working. Wide and ToF. But let’s say the target is too far away. And for some reason the user can’t get closer (like standing on a balcony) so the user taps on the Telephoto sign. The Wide camera turns off and the Telephoto one activates. In another scenario. Let’s say it’s too close. And they can’t go further (standing by a wall) then the ultrawide camera activates. Turning off the wide one.
